headline: Stranded Costs From Divestitures Could Be a Game Changer for Kimberly-Clark (KMB)
summary: At the recent Piper Sandler Growth Frontiers Conference in Nashville, Kimberly-Clark executives disclosed that the company faces approximately US$150 million in stranded costs from recent divestitures, leading to a projected US$0.30–US$0.40 reduction in near-term earnings per share. While the company reiterated its 2030 financial targets, management’s warning about immediate earnings headwinds from divestiture-related costs presents a significant short-term challenge for...
